pageContext.claim: “Now, this is a public meeting. Because, you know, when you cover this, the people watching may say oh, he met with Lavrov. Well, this was announced that I'm meeting with Lavrov. Just like a number of days ago, I spoke -- had a very good conversation -- very public in the sense that everybody knew this was taking place.”
pageContext.analysis: The meeting was not public, but closed to the press. Even U.S. media cameras were barred, though the White House allowed a Russan TASS photographer in the meeting.
